intro: Sison coniifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sison, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically clustered at the ends of the branches. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
